item.description: A photo taken of a Steam Deck portable console sitting on a desk with a USB DVD drive connected to it. On the Deck‚Äôs screen, a still image from The Brothers Bloom is showing. With no other options to...
item.content:encoded: A photo taken of a Steam Deck portable console sitting on a desk with a USB DVD drive connected to it. On the Deck‚Äôs screen, a still image from The Brothers Bloom is showing. With no other options to play DVDs, Valve‚Äôs portable gaming PC (clumsily) came to the rescue I‚Äôve messed up at multiple points in my life if I‚Äôm relying on a Steam Deck to help me play DVDs. But that‚Äôs where I‚Äôm at, having gotten rid of practically every device I owned over the past few years that could play discs. The Ste...

item.title: Distilling step-by-step: Outperforming larger language models with less training data and smaller model sizes | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Cheng-Yu Hsieh, Student Researcher, and Chen-Yu Lee, Research Scientist, Cloud AI Team Large language models (LLMs) have enabled a new data-efficient learning paradigm wherein they can ...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Cheng-Yu Hsieh, Student Researcher, and Chen-Yu Lee, Research Scientist, Cloud AI Team Large language models (LLMs) have enabled a new data-efficient learning paradigm wherein they can be used to solve unseen new tasks via zero-shot or few-shot prompting. However, LLMs are challenging to deploy for real-world applications due to their sheer size. For instance, serving a single 175 billion LLM requires at least 350GB of GPU memory using specialized infrastructure, not to mention th...

item.title: Terraria devs donate $200K to open-source engines in wake of Unity changes | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Re-Logic/Re-Logic Incredible Unity might be facing the ire that comes with a near-universal condemnation of a new policy change, but at least things are looking up for two open-source game en...
item.content:encoded: Image: Re-Logic/Re-Logic Incredible Unity might be facing the ire that comes with a near-universal condemnation of a new policy change, but at least things are looking up for two open-source game engines. On Tuesday, the developers of Terraria announced that their team plans to donate $200,000 to two open-source game development engines: Godot and FNA. This announcement follows one made on Sep. 12 by the widely used game engine, Unity, regarding a change in its pricing policy that sparked outc...

item.title: Sea of Thieves‚Äô next season adds a safer game mode with no PvP enabled | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Rare/Microsoft Game Studios Sailing the Safer Seas Sailing in Sea of Thieves has always had an inherent level of risk. Not only do you have to worry about skeletons, ghost ships, and sea beas...
item.content:encoded: Image: Rare/Microsoft Game Studios Sailing the Safer Seas Sailing in Sea of Thieves has always had an inherent level of risk. Not only do you have to worry about skeletons, ghost ships, and sea beasts, but other players have been known to roam and hunt for prey. There‚Äôs a consistent PvP element to most parts of the game, and it gives the otherwise cheerful world a tense edge. Today, Rare announced that Season 10 of Sea of Thieves will offer a chill game mode as an alternative: Safer Seas. Safe...

item.description: Image: Lego The carnivorous addition to Lego Super Mario arrives Nov. 6 Joining the growing catalog of Lego Super Mario products, the Piranha Plant gets its own $59.99 model on Nov. 6. The adjustabl...
item.content:encoded: Image: Lego The carnivorous addition to Lego Super Mario arrives Nov. 6 Joining the growing catalog of Lego Super Mario products, the Piranha Plant gets its own $59.99 model on Nov. 6. The adjustable stalk, leaves, and mouth of the 540-piece carnivorous plant will allow you to model the lil‚Äô guy into a variety of emotive poses. While we all know the favorite snack of the Piranha Plant is red-clad Italian plumbers, this set also comes packaged with a pair of gold coins to feed it, in case it ge...

item.title: Fallout 76 heads to Atlantic City this winter with a new Expedition | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Bethesda Game Studios/Bethesda Softworks From Appalachia to the casinos of Atlantic City Fallout 76 started in West Virginia, but the game‚Äôs Expeditions allow the player to venture out of App...
item.content:encoded: Image: Bethesda Game Studios/Bethesda Softworks From Appalachia to the casinos of Atlantic City Fallout 76 started in West Virginia, but the game‚Äôs Expeditions allow the player to venture out of Appalachia and go to new cities in post-apocalyptic America. The first Expedition was centered around Pittsburgh, known as The Pitt. Today, Bethesda released more information on the second Expedition, which will take place in Atlantic City. This will be a two-part content update, and the first part wil...

item.title: Where to pre-order Assassin‚Äôs Creed Mirage before launch day | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Ubisoft Sneak and stab your way through this new adventure starting Oct. 8 The Assassin‚Äôs Creed franchise is returning to its roots with the upcoming Assassin‚Äôs Creed Mirage, launching on Xbo...
item.content:encoded: Image: Ubisoft Sneak and stab your way through this new adventure starting Oct. 8 The Assassin‚Äôs Creed franchise is returning to its roots with the upcoming Assassin‚Äôs Creed Mirage, launching on Xbox, PlayStation, and Windows PC on Oct. 8. You can currently pre-order the console versions of the game from Amazon, Best Buy, Target, Walmart, or GameStop. If you plan to pick the game up for PC, you can reserve a copy through the Epic Games Store. Where Assassin‚Äôs Creed Origins took gamers to ancie...

item.title: Fighting games should never reboot their stories | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: NetherRealm Studios/Warner Bros. Games Please don‚Äôt do this to me, Mortal Kombat 1 It is a commonly held belief that fighting game stories are, categorically, bad. Stories are not what people...
item.content:encoded: Image: NetherRealm Studios/Warner Bros. Games Please don‚Äôt do this to me, Mortal Kombat 1 It is a commonly held belief that fighting game stories are, categorically, bad. Stories are not what people come to fighting games for, the logic goes. They are an optional indulgence, and a compromised one at that, because they must always account for why, for example, a giant military cyborg would ever fight a kangaroo. I disagree. Fighting game stories rule, actually, because they are such brazen work...

item.title: Sand Land has style, but can the manga-inspired game be the next Mad Max? | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: ILCA/Bandai Namco Entertainment So far, the Akira Toriyama adaptation only dazzles on the surface Out of all of the demos I played at Gamescom 2023, Sand Land was easily the most perplexing. ...
item.content:encoded: Image: ILCA/Bandai Namco Entertainment So far, the Akira Toriyama adaptation only dazzles on the surface Out of all of the demos I played at Gamescom 2023, Sand Land was easily the most perplexing. Based on the one-shot manga series by Dragon Ball and Chrono Trigger legend Akira Toriyama, Sand Land is a visually exciting game, but a hands-on preview left me wanting more substance beneath the style. Sand Land is an action-RPG set in an ecocidal world plagued by water shortage, with a 2,500-year...

item.title: Baldur‚Äôs Gate 3 fans are hyped to finally change their character‚Äôs appearance | Polygon - Gaming

item.content:encoded: Image: Larian Studios via Polygon Patch 3 introduces a Magic Mirror Since Baldur‚Äôs Gate 3 came out, fans have been clamoring for a way to change their characters‚Äô appearance during gameplay, after leaving the character creator screen. While there‚Äôs a way to respec characters‚Äô ‚Äî including Origin characters‚Äô ‚Äî classes and abilities, there hasn‚Äôt been a way to change elements of their appearance (beyond giving them sick new outfits). But Patch 3, which launches Friday, promises changes to this an...

item.title: A catalogue of genetic mutations to help pinpoint the cause of diseases | DeepMind Blog
item.description: We've released a catalogue of ‚Äòmissense‚Äô mutations where researchers can learn more about what effect they may have. Missense variants are genetic mutations that can affect the function of human prote...
item.content:encoded: We've released a catalogue of ‚Äòmissense‚Äô mutations where researchers can learn more about what effect they may have. Missense variants are genetic mutations that can affect the function of human proteins. In some cases, they can lead to diseases such as cystic fibrosis, sickle-cell anaemia, or cancer. The AlphaMissense catalogue was developed using AlphaMissense, our new AI model which classifies missense variants.

item.content:encoded: Posted by Haolin Jia, Software Engineer, and Qifei Wang, Senior Software Engineer, Core ML In recent years, we have witnessed rising interest across consumers and researchers in integrated augmented reality (AR) experiences using real-time face feature generation and editing functions in mobile applications, including short videos, virtual reality, and gaming. As a result, there is a growing demand for lightweight, yet high-quality face generation and editing models, which are often based on ...

item.content:encoded: Posted by Gabriel Barcik and Duc-Hieu Tran, Research Engineers, Google Research In today's digital age, smartphones and desktop web browsers serve as the primary tools for accessing news and information. However, the proliferation of website clutter ‚Äî encompassing complex layouts, navigation elements, and extraneous links ‚Äî significantly impairs both the reading experience and article navigation. This issue is particularly acute for individuals with accessibility requirements. To improve ...

item.description: Posted by Matt Barnes, Software Engineer, Google Research Routing in Google Maps remains one of our most helpful and frequently used features. Determining the best route from A to B requires makin...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Matt Barnes, Software Engineer, Google Research Routing in Google Maps remains one of our most helpful and frequently used features. Determining the best route from A to B requires making complex trade-offs between factors including the estimated time of arrival (ETA), tolls, directness, surface conditions (e.g., paved, unpaved roads), and user preferences, which vary across transportation mode and local geography. Often, the most natural visibility we have into travelers' preferen...

item.title: A Comprehensive Guide to Pinecone Vector Databases | KDnuggets
item.description: This blog discusses vector databases, specifically pinecone vector databases. A vector database is a type of database that stores data as mathematical vectors, which represent features or attributes. ...
item.content:encoded: This blog discusses vector databases, specifically pinecone vector databases. A vector database is a type of database that stores data as mathematical vectors, which represent features or attributes. These vectors have multiple dimensions, capturing complex data relationships. This allows for efficient similarity and distance calculations, making it useful for tasks like machine learning, data analysis, and recommendation systems.

item.title: Differentially private median and more | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Edith Cohen and Uri Stemmer, Research Scientists, Google Research Differential privacy (DP) is a rigorous mathematical definition of privacy. DP algorithms are randomized to protect use...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Edith Cohen and Uri Stemmer, Research Scientists, Google Research Differential privacy (DP) is a rigorous mathematical definition of privacy. DP algorithms are randomized to protect user data by ensuring that the probability of any particular output is nearly unchanged when a data point is added or removed. Therefore, the output of a DP algorithm does not disclose the presence of any one data point. There has been significant progress in both foundational research and adoption of ...
